Patient Particulars: Name: Shari; Sex: Female; Marital status: Unmarried
Presenting Complaints (Symptoms):
1. Increased talkativeness
2. Increased goal-directed activity
3. Decreased need for sleep
History: Present history: Patient was always fond of baking. Around two weeks ago she tried making some desserts which were later appreciated by his nephew and others. It boosted her confidence to change her career and plans to establish a business by opening a bakery near college campus for better sale. She also has been sleeping less without getting tired as she spends most of her time in her business idea; Past history: She was hospitalised around 4 months ago as she was experiencing low mood; Personal history: She recently got into trouble at her work as she was trying to promote her business at her workplace. She later got a notice warning her against losing her job. She is less bothered about it as she is completely indulged in planning for her bakery. She met a man who supported her idea and got into a romantic relationship with him soon after; Substance use history: She does not consume any psychoactive substance.
Current Mental Status Examination: Behavior: Patient was cooperative and rapport could be established; Speech: productivity- increased; Mood: Elevated; Affect: Broad; Insight: Grade 1
Issues discussed in Current Session: Patient was brought by her brother. She has been talking a lot than usual, been overly indulged in her business idea, sleeps less and spends time on the same but doesn't feel tired. She was admitted in a hospital earlier as she was experiencing a low mood. She discussed about her business idea in detail.
Clinical Diagnosis by Reviewer: F31.1 Bipolar Affective Disorder, current episode mania without psychotic symptoms
